middleware.name: psoc6pdl
middleware.desc: The PSoC™ 6 Peripheral Driver Library (PDL) integrates device header files, startup code, and low-level peripheral drivers into a single package.

middleware.name: psoc6cm0p
middleware.desc: PSoC™ 6 Cortex M0+ prebuilt images enabling flash write services and BLE event handling.

middleware.name: psoc6hal
middleware.desc: PSoC™ 6 Hardware Abstraction Layer package, provides a set of APIs to initialize, configure, and use the PSoC™ 6 MCU resources using the using the defined Hardware Abstraction Layer.

middleware.name: psoc6make
middleware.desc: PSoC™ 6 Base Build Library.

middleware.name: core-lib
middleware.desc: The Core Library provides device agnostic utilities that all middleware can rely on. This includes a generic result type and some common utility functions.

middleware.name: abstraction-rtos
middleware.desc:
The RTOS Abstraction Library provides a generic API that allows ModusToolbox™ middleware to be written in an RTOS agnostic manner. It also contains implementations of the Abstraction Layer for FreeRTOS, CMSIS RTOS, and ThreadX.

Note: This library has specific requirements on the underlying RTOS configuration. See the Readme.md file for details.

middleware.name: CY8CKIT-028-EPD
middleware.desc: The CY8CKIT-028-EPD library provides APIs for interacting with the Shield Board's E2271CS021 EInk display, BMI-160 Motion Sensor, SPK0838HT4H-B Microphone, and Thermistor.

middleware.name: CY8CKIT-028-SENSE
middleware.desc: The Sense Shield Board (CY8CKIT-028-SENSE) has been designed as a companion to add common sensors, audio components and user interface to an Arduino based baseboard. The CY8CKIT-028-TFT library provides APIs for interacting with the Shield Board's OLED Display (SSD1306), Orientation Sensor (BMX-160), XENSIV Pressure/Temperature Sensor (DPS310XTSA1), 2 XENSIV MEMS Microphones (IM69D130V01XTSA1), PDM Microphone example code (SPK0838HT4HB), and Audio Codec (WM8960).

middleware.name: CY8CKIT-028-TFT
middleware.desc: The CY8CKIT-028-TFT library provides APIs for interacting with the Shield Board's ST7789v TFT display, BMI-160 Motion Sensor, SPK0838HT4H-B Microphone, and Light Sensor.

middleware.name: CY8CKIT-032
middleware.desc: The CY8CKIT-032 library provides APIs for interacting with the Shield Board's OLED display and the PSoC™ 4 Analog Coprocessor to read analog sensors (temperature, humidity, ambient light and potentiometer voltage) and to provide a CAPSENSE™ user interface.

middleware.name: retarget-io
middleware.desc: The Retarget IO library provides APIs for transmitting messages to or from the board via standard printf/scanf functions using a UART connection which is generally connected to a host machine.

middleware.name: rgb-led
middleware.desc: The RGB LED library provides APIs for controlling the color and intensity the RGB LED on our kits.

middleware.name: serial-flash
middleware.desc: The Serial Flash library provides APIs for interacting with an external flash connected to the SPI or QSPI interface.

middleware.name: audio-codec-ak4954a
middleware.desc: This library provides functions to support use of the AK4954A audio codec found on the CY8CKIT-028-TFT shield.

middleware.name: audio-codec-wm8960
middleware.desc: This library provides functions to support use of the WM8960 audio codec available on the CY8CKIT-028-SENSE shield.

middleware.name: display-eink-e2271cs021
middleware.desc: This library provides functions for supporting the 2.7" EPD Display (E2271CS021). This is the same display as used on the CY8CKIT-028-EPD shield.

middleware.name: display-oled-ssd1306
middleware.desc: This library provides functions to support the 128x64 pixel dot matrix OLED display driven by SSD1306 controller. This is the same display as used on the CY8CKIT-032 shield.

middleware.name: display-tft-st7789v
middleware.desc: This library provides functions for supporting a 2.4 inch TFT LCD driven by an ST7789V controller. This is the same display as used on the CY8CKIT-028-TFT shield.

middleware.name: sensor-light
middleware.desc: This library provides functions to support use of a phototransistor ambient light sensor such as the TEMT6000 as used on the CY8CKIT-028-TFT shield.

middleware.name: sensor-motion-bmi160
middleware.desc: This library provides functions for interfacing with the BMI-160 I2C/SPI 16-bit Inertial Measurement Unit with three axis accelerometer and three axis gyroscope as used on the CY8CKIT-028-TFT and CY8CKIT-028-TFT shields.

middleware.name: sensor-orientation-bmx160
middleware.desc: This library provides functions for interfacing with the BMX-160 I2C/SPI 16-bit Absolute Orientation Sensor with three axis accelerometer, three axis gyroscope, and three axis magnetometer as used on the CY8CKIT-028-SENSE shield.

middleware.name: sensor-xensiv-dps3xx
middleware.desc: This library provides functions for interfacing with the XENSIV DPS-310/368 Barometric Pressure Sensors. These are miniaturized digital barometric air pressure sensors with ultra-high precision (±2 cm) and a low current consumption, capable of measuring both pressure and temperature. The pressure sensor element is based on a capacitive sensing principle which guarantees high precision during temperature changes. This library can be setup to use the ModusToolbox™ HAL interface, or using user provided communication functions.

middleware.name: thermistor
middleware.desc: This library provides functions for reading an NTC GPIO based thermistor temperature sensor as used on some shields.

middleware.name: udb-sdio-whd
middleware.desc: The UDB SDIO for WHD library provides a UDB based SDIO interface that allows for communicating between a PSoC™ 6 and a AIROC™ wireless device such as the CYW4343W, CYW43438, or CYW43012.

middleware.name: whd-bsp-integration
middleware.desc: The WHD + BSP Integration library provides some convenience functions for connecting the WiFi Host Driver (WHD) library to a Board Support Package (BSP) that includes a WLAN chip.

middleware.name: bless
middleware.desc: PSoC™ 6 BLE Middleware is a comprehensive API to configure the BLE Stack and the underlying chip hardware.

middleware.name: capsense
middleware.desc:
Capacitive sensing solution (CAPSENSE™) enables a variety of applications such as touch, gesture and proximity detection for home appliances, automotive, IoT, industrial applications, and more. A CAPSENSE™ supports multiple interfaces (widgets) using both Self-Capacitance (CSD) and Mutual-Capacitance (CSX) sensing methods.
Additional Information:
  • CAPSENSE™ Middleware Library README.md
  • CAPSENSE™ Middleware Library RELEASE.md
  • CAPSENSE™ Middleware Library API reference guide

middleware.name: dfu
middleware.desc:
The Device Firmware Update (DFU) Middleware Library provides a low-level API for the implementation of firmware loader and firmware loadable applications using a number of transport interfaces, e.g. UART, I2C, SPI, and USB.
Additional Information:
  • DFU Middleware Library README.md
  • DFU Middleware Library RELEASE.md
  • DFU Middleware Library API reference guide

middleware.name: emeeprom
middleware.desc:
The Emulated EEPROM middleware emulates an EEPROM device in the PSoC™ & XMC 7xxx™ device flash memory. This allows you to store nonvolatile data with support for wear leveling and redundant copy features.
Additional Information:
  • Em_EEPROM Middleware Library README.md
  • Em_EEPROM Middleware Library RELEASE.md
  • Em_EEPROM Middleware Library API reference guide

middleware.name: emwin
middleware.desc: SEGGER emWin embedded graphic library and graphical user interface (GUI) framework.

middleware.name: usbdev
middleware.desc: USB Device library for a full-speed USB 2.0 compliant device framework.

middleware.name: freertos
middleware.desc:
A FreeRTOS is a small operating system for microcontrollers. A FreeRTOS kernel is distributed as standard C source files with configuration header file.

License Disclaimer:
Adding this library will download and add FreeRTOS to your project. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the FreeRTOS license.
Additional Information:
  • FreeRTOS kernel README.md
  • FreeRTOS kernel RELEASE.md
  • FreeRTOS home page

version.desc: 10.4.4 release. Obsolete in favor of freertos 10.4.302 release

middleware.name: freertos-posix
middleware.desc: POSIX implementation for FreeRTOS

middleware.name: clib-support
middleware.desc:
The CLib Support Library provides the necessary hooks to make C library functions such as malloc and free thread safe. This implementation is specific to FreeRTOS.

Note: FREERTOS flags configUSE_MUTEXES, configUSE_RECURSIVE_MUTEXES, and configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION must be enabled

middleware.name: kv-store
middleware.desc: This library provides a convenient way to store information as key-value pairs in non-volatile storage.

middleware.name: bluetooth-freertos
middleware.desc:
The Bluetooth® freertos middleware library wraps the embedded BLE host stack and provides APIs to interact with Bluetooth® chips.
Additional Information:
  • Bluetooth® freertos library README.md
  • Bluetooth® freertos library RELEASE.md
  • Bluetooth® freertos library API reference guide

middleware.name: btstack
middleware.desc:
BTSTACK is our Bluetooth® Host Protocol Stack implementation. The stack is optimized to work on our Bluetooth® controllers. The BTSTACK supports Bluetooth® BR/EDR and Bluetooth® LE core protocols. The stack is available as libraries built for Arm® Cortex®-M3 and Cortex®-M4 cores using Arm®, GCC and IAR toolchains. Further there are two build variants of stack libraries, LE only and Dual-mode. Applications that use LE can take advantage of reduced size of LE only library and build LE peripheral or even central applications. Dual-mode library supports both LE and BR/EDR protocols.
Additional Information:
  • BTSTACK release notes
  • BTSTACK API reference manual

middleware.name: MCUboot
middleware.desc: MCUboot is a secure bootloader for 32-bit MCUs.

middleware.name: mbedtls
middleware.desc:
ARM mbedTLS library is an implementation of the TLS and SSL protocols and the respective cryptographic algorithms. mbedTLS is an open source TLS/SSL library which has cryptographic capabilities. Using this library in a project will cause mbedTLS to be downloaded on your computer. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the mbedTLS license and regional use restrictions (including abiding by all applicable export control laws).
Additional Information:
  • Mbed TLS Library Information

version.desc: Stable 2.16.6 release - Resolves security vulnerabilities present in 2.16.3
